quote_a: when I needed new tires for my car after getting quotes, I found GPT to be really useful. It helped me by summarizing the options I had, which gave me confidence in the choices I was making.
explanation: The participant reports high confidence in AI-assisted purchase decisions yet simultaneously rates their overall trust in AI at only moderate (3/5), revealing a gap between enacted reliance and stated trust.

quote_a: when I needed new tires for my car after getting quotes, I found GPT to be really useful. It helped me by summarizing the options I had, which gave me confidence in the choices I was making.
quote_b: I have had a couple of instances where I recall it doing things that I knew were not correct, and I had to prompt it to check things.
explanation: The participant claims AI gave them confident, reliable decision support but also admits it produced errors they had to catch, undermining the reliability implied by expressed confidence.

quote_a: I was expecting something more like ChatGPT when you are asking questions via voice, where it would actually come back and talk to me.
quote_b: I think it probably would have made me feel put on the spot a bit more. But, yeah, hearing it could be kind of a little bit odd, but it was just sort of what I was expecting.
explanation: The participant first frames voice interaction as what they expected and wanted, then immediately hedges by saying it would have felt odd and put them on the spot, walking back the expressed preference.
